intro: Teline monspessulana, commonly known as the Portuguese heather, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are dark green, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Teline monspessulana thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
